comments.commentBody: Boehner as the pot to Cruz's kettle.
Wow, that's all you had to say on the subject.  If it were about Hillary you'd have 3, 4, or 5 paragraphs of bile to say.
or she might have simply eaten a peanut butter sandwich while tears rolled down her face, laughing harder than she could remember, as she read about Hillary going all Satan card on Cruz...

Boehner is just a tad less as relevant now as he was during his tenure as Speaker, and about as powerful. Had he done more, when he could, Lucifer might not have gotten this far. Oh, well...

---

www.rimaregas.com

@A Canadian said: "It is unfortunate that Ms. Swinton allowed herself to be sucked into this mess. "
- - -
What mess? You mean accepting an interesting movie role?

The notion that, in the 21st C., an actor from Tibet, or China, or elsewhere in East Asia, was not suitable for the role of the Ancient One is odd. That Marvel avoided a Tibetan in particular in order to prevent reprisals from China, or at the very least, to amp up its box office take in that country, well, that too is "a mess", as far as I'm concerned. I doubt that I'm alone.

Sad that I had to spell it out for you.

It is unfortunate that Ms. Swinton allowed herself to be sucked into this mess. Regardless of the post-facto denials, it seems pretty clear that, when push comes to shove, business types will almost always err on the side of kissing up to the powerful and riding roughshod over the rest.

Marvel, Marvel. :(

We as Americans should be reminded at every turn about the nightmare of our early slave economy and the everlasting harm to our national psyche and if it takes a foreign visitor to do so then please encourage them to bring it up with every American they meet since we surpress it at most turns. We need to bring it into clear conciousness before we can move ahead.
Here's what Xian'er should be programmed to tell you: Force6delta, clearly pomposity is the enemy of simplicity and humility and simplicity and humility are the friends of salvation.  OM!

Roberts main argument against "fee and dividend" is that "the real world offers no examples of dividends being used to successfully muster support for a carbon tax." I believe what he really means is "it has never been done." I would argue that just because it has never been done is no argument against trying. Later he argues there is "no evidence that dividend schemes would elicit much public support." and "What little polling evidence exists seems to point to the opposite direction." However, polling data are notoriously fickle, particularly when no one has experience with it. Support would likely shift dramatically, once people started receiving checks.

A culture can be altered only from the inside.

Pushing from outside only drives them together against what is alien to "them" against Other with us as Other this time.

We understand Other very well when we are uniting against it. It works the same the other way.

Of course we should support those inside attempting to do what we agree is right. It is difficult to "support" without crossing that line. Remember, that means we offend even those we think we are helping, as this author points out.

Also, the women we seek to help are themselves inside that culture, and they love their sons and husbands and many of their fathers. We won't get far with most women telling them that they love evil men, their own baby is evil.

We also won't get far telling them they are weak or inferior until they are more like us, more like the alien Other. That would not work here even if it was true, and it won't work there either.

Some of their cultural preferences which are not the same as ours really are their preferences. They get to have their own preferences. If we seek to deny that, they will not see us as helping them, nor want to be helped.

Given all that, this is actually very difficult. It does not get easier when we are so sure we are completely right, completely superior, and our (rather recent) ideas are the only possible ideas for others.
Trump did not "admit".  He was praising her the only way he knows.  I'm no Trump fan, believe me.

In response to Donnelley Nunes.

Donald Trump has worked extremely hard to turn the million dollars that his father left him into several billion. Just look at all the properties he has either built or acquired. Only a mean spirited person would be unable to see that.

Trump seems to have been most effective when he has been able to call the shots on the way his opponents are defined "Lyin Ted" "Little Rubio" - I suspect he's banking that casting HRC as the "women card" will somehow reduce this very complex woman to someone he can see eye to eye with... someone one-dimensional.

Hillary, Bernie, which ever one of you goes up against this man, please talk to some elementary school teachers about how to deal with a person who call other people names - "ignore them" and keep on with your good work.

Also Mr. Trump, I'm not sure if you have actually considered this yet, but you do know that being POUS means you are actually going to have to work hard, right? How is it going to feel for you when you actually have real responsibility that requires you do work for other people?
Haha. Wait till the Millennial women get into the workplace. They will find out then if they are in control.

@Joe Barnett:  Excellent comment!  And should HRC need an epithet (which I doubt she will), she can always refer to Trump as "Dim-bulb Donny" (because he absolutely is the lowest-wattage bulb in any room!).

How sad that people label their opponents as totally vile and cartoonist buffoons. Its an easy way to dismiss anyone who disagrees with you.  Harder and more valuable is to explore your opponents' viewpoint and perhaps learn something. I try to...
That would be a disaster. She has way too much to prove. I want a moderator willing to be a moderator only. Please, someone please less polarizing than Kelly (and smarter than Blitzer).
I would like Megyn Kelly to moderate the first Clinton-Trump debate.
So True!!

Trump has no idea what normsl Amerticsns go through evetyday to survive. Ask him what a loaf of bread costs or a gallon of milk and he will have no idea at all. How can he be President when he has never walked in the shoes of American citizens? Born into wealth and lives a life of privilege .
here's to you and the millions go others...

Bring it on, Donald. The women of America are not all beauty queens like your wife. Some of us, most of us, work outside the home and raise children without nurses or nannies. We don't have designer clothes, stylists or personal trainers. What we do have is personal responsibilities you can't even fathom, daily jobs we do without staff or assistants, and we earn our own incomes even at 78 cents on the dollar.  Many of us are single parents, heads of household or primary breadwinners since we have unemployed or underemployed spouses. We are educated, independent and we vote. We don't need you to tell us why and for whom. There is no "woman card" for Clinton to play. Your mistake is assuming that.

I don't recall her exact words during the debate, but she touted becoming the first woman president as a reason for support. And then her reaction to Madeline Albright's foolish comment: “We can tell our story of how we climbed the ladder, and a lot of you younger women think it’s done,” Ms. Albright said of the broader fight for women’s equality. “It’s not done. There’s a special place in hell for women who don’t help each other!”
Mrs. Clinton, 68, laughed, slowly clapped and took a large sip of her beverage.
My woman card will beat your anti-woman card any day, Walker.
You didn't hear her reply, did you?

How is "vote for me bc I'll be the first female president" not playing the woman's card? If Bobby Jindal had said: "vote for me bc I'll be the first Indian-American President" wouldn't it be equally fair to say that I was playing the ethnic card? And besides, what message is Hillary trying to make to women: That women have to be handled with kid's gloves in a campaign? Are we supposed to be politically correct when it comes to women candidates? Aren't women supposed to be just as strong as men?

It reminds me of an Onion headline from a few months ago: "Female Presidential Candidate Who Was First Lady, United States Senator, Secretary Of State Told To Be More Inspiring."

The fact is, as resumes go, Clinton is the most qualified presidential candidate we've had in decades. And, actually, her "performance" as SoS was quite impressive. Not sure we've had one who worked harder in recent memory, and most of what she did went completely unnoticed, of course, because it's a thankless job. (The SoS doesn't make foreign policy, by the way.)

I think her answer was incredibly honest.  She always tries to tell the truth but she is a very smart woman and a lawyer; she knows that sometimes, especially in a world where people want sound bites, that the truth can be complicated, especially when people are asking nuanced questions.  Oh, and by the way, she is the most honest person in the race according to fact check.
She doesn't rub me the wrong way, but thanks for speaking for the rest of the country, CAdVA.

Hillary IS likeable. I am a woman, I know many women, and we all like Hillary Clinton. Polls show that women AND MEN do like Hillary Clinton. Your post reads like ill considered propaganda as it repeats right wing tropes. This because you don't discuss a single issue.

Obama NEVER said about Hillary "you're likeable enough", sarcastically or not. Why do you suppose Obama picked Hillary Clinton to be our Secretary of State? Why you suppose that New York voters picked her to be their senator? Why do you suppose she's respected among world leaders? Why do you think she's respected and loved by many participants in NGO programs for her life long work on behalf of children and women?
Just remember that it was right about then he decided Hillary would make a great Secretary of State.  He even said so, without naming the office.  He was playing to win.

Many democrats would like to gloss over this but Clinton is the sort of woman disliked by women.
There is something about her personality that does rub both men and women the wrong way. It is unfortunate but there is nothing she can do to change this.
Just look at how many faces she has put forward. All of which are two dimensional. It is this that the public sees. Nothing makes someone more unlikable than being perceived as a phony.
Obama was sarcastic when he said, "You're likable enough".

But he can't because he's who he is which is why the republican voters like him.
He believes (as they do) that women are not the equal of men. That isn't going to change. Really it won't.

@melinda
Really. Enough of these mass judgments in pluralistic terms.
"We don't like her"....."We don't trust her".
Who is this ubiquitous and unknown "WE"???
And if for a minute you think that Trump is any better, you have got a major wake-up call in store for you.

You've fallen for Republican opposition work, live and well since the 1990s. Time to wake up:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V_eTKSzoAUY

If Donald wants to win this one, and 'knock her out' of the race (as he likes to say), he needs to do it on Hillary's record & poor judgement (...and, believe me, there is plenty of material!!)

She's already highly mistrusted & unlikeable. He should leave it alone.

Stick to the issues & her character. If he turns off women, he makes her more likeable (by default), loses their vote and hands her the election. He cannot win without the women's vote.

Be smart, Trump. He has to shift into 4th gear for the general and change strategies. My fear is, he is simply not bright enough to do it. Hopefully, his oldest daughter might talk some sense into him! She's the smartest one of the Trump clan.

To be honest, I don't care for him but I will never vote for Hillary Clinton.
Wow, that Bible citation Bible citation (2 Corinthians 11:14) makes all the difference, NOT.

Mark

I loved the biblical reference, I needed to look up the phrase, it is the following :

"And no wonder, for Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light."

I love this, because I have been making the same point, complete with Bible citation (2 Corinthians 11:14)

To me it also confirms that the Republicans like the former Speaker do have the good sense to know the truth, they've just settled into refusing to admit it and doing the opposite so long as they have the power to do wrong.
Now that he can do no more harm and is instead now admitting the truth he had denied, maybe we don't need to loathe him anymore.
Hide the truth until it doesn't matter? What, then gloat?

excluding the major cancer inducing factor of inhaling foreign matter into the precious lungs is perhaps the best medicine for this life threatening habit.  we inhale any number of known/unknown chemicals on a daily basis just driving behind endless streams of vehicles, working on factories, sniffing deodorant laden bodies and wafting completely non-metric components of a billion years of natural emissions.  burning tobacco and sucking it directly in to get some profit share up for these tobacco growers is insane.  CalTech boffo's can surmise what they want, but the time to mitigate the death rate is NOW!

Then maybe you need to back the heck off and get out of the vapers PERSONAL space! Vape or no vape, crowding into my personal space might just get you a poke in the mouth or shoved across the floor into the nearest wall. Vape plumes, even large ones, only cover a few cubic feet, and dissipate within seconds. Claiming the scent is harming you is like claiming you gained weight from smelling a chocolate cake baking in an oven 12 feet away.. it ain't going to happen. If you are so concerned with additives.. maybe you need to go on an additive free diet. No food color, no added flavorings, no preservatives, no cake, no cookies, no chocolate, no TIC TACS! No nothing.. just a strict diet of water... Oh wait.. they add fluorine and bleach to water, don't they. Maybe you should just stay inside your home and avoid all those nasty things completely. OH and don't worry, an average human will die from dehydration in less than 7 days. So your worries about "additives" will be at an end.

I apologize to the other forum readers, but people that post to forums with out a clue what they are talking about is just plain annoying. It is obvious this person did no research at all about the contents of vape fluid. Granted, some juice does contain bad ingredients, but as far as I know, vapers avoid those, which in effect will force self regulation among the producers.

I have no problem with cigarette smokers using E-Cigs in their own homes, but don't let them expose me to their nicotine and additives vapor by permitting public use of E-Cigs because it helps them quit.

You can count me in as an e-cigarette success story.  I smoked for over 30 years, and had family nag me for almost the same amount of time to quit.  I had tried quitting cold turkey, using patches, using gum, using Chantix.  I could never quit for more than 26-36 hours before the cravings got so bad that I went back to smoking.  Back around 2009, I had tried e-cigs and hated it.  It really wasn't like smoking and inhaling through a chunk of saturated material was just too hard.  Since then, the technology advanced by leaps and bounds.  In just a few short years, vaporizer technology went from the equivalent of the Model T to a modern car with a biturbo engine with climate control, navigation, cruise control and collision avoidance.  I decided to give vaping another try.  On January 6, 2015 I smoked my last cigarette and started vaping.  For the first few weeks, I vaped a lot.  Every time I felt the craving for a cigarette, I picked up my vaporizer.  It will be 14 months next week since I started vaping and I have not had a single cigarette in all that time.  Every once in a while I will still think about cigarettes, but then my vaporizer is there and after a few puffs the thought goes away.  One clue that I am winning the battle with smoking is that now I can go much longer without vaping than I could without smoking.  In the past I couldn't go longer than a couple of hours between cigarettes before I started getting the jitters.
Yes, and drinking too much water can also kill you.  How about some artificial sweeteners?  The list of things that COULD kill a person when consumed in excess is fairly lengthy.
